text: @fosandtime Haha get over it pal
Men with beards use razors to line up their facial hair, you dumb hipster.

@blackwoodtyler disagree. Its a matter of perspective and political view. Anyone can be a piece of shit. Gillette is counting on the morons on both sides to take the ad at face value, winning one side who perceives the brand one way and loosing some on the other side with the "old perception". In time, most forget and become customers again (a win, lose, win strategy). If done correctly, expanding the customer base by (x) factor. "Shock advertising" is nothing new.
@catherinemabley oh I apologize I just saw this on my responses.

@oofenshmirtz2911 difference between you and this other guy is your swearing was not directed towards anyone. Your responses voiced your opinion while being respectful at the same time. My comment was definitely not directed towards you
@catherinemabley I just swear. That has nothing to do with my respect for others.
@catherinemabley No, you are a hypocrite.
@marqusloqus I treat everyone with respect. Clearly you don’t, when you can’t express an opinion without swearing. Keep being the best man you can be.... Have a great weekend
@catherinemabley Till then we don't give fuck to your opinion.

@catherinemabley This post uses body shaming tactic against men. But you ignored it , that is female hypocrisy aka #toxicfemininity. Don't forget to look at yourself in the mirror as well before judging others.

@catherinemabley look I apologize but my views are not going to change. I’m sorry but I see things in the way I see them. And I see that this is some feminist shit again, like I said if this were directed at women then everyone would lose their mind, but again not that many people care about this. Overall we all have problems and we all need to fix them together. Bye and sorry if I annoyed many of you which I know I did. If anyone feels that they can change my views feel free too but for the moment I just want to go my way, and you can go your way.

@oofenshmirtz2911 if you would like some insight as to what woman have had to endure for years, I strongly suggest you watch the speech given by Oprah at the Golden Globes. And that is not to say, the commercial was only regarding of treatment of women, but society as a whole. The point was for men to hold other men accountable, to teach the young boys that bullying and physically assaulting one another is not okay, and for all men to lead by example. At no point, did they say ALL men, and if you took anything away from this commercial than that, you may be part of the issue. It’s directed towards men, because razors are typically a male driven product. And if you think after the #metoo movement, that sexual harassment is still not an issue, you are sadly mistaken. I get comments regularly about my breasts, or other physical features by complete strangers. Is this acceptable because I chose to work in a bar? NO! I will always support ANY campaign that encourages men OR women, to do better, be better and be kinder
@robbietheintern thank you for at least trying to change my point of view even though my view stays unchanged, thank you.
@robbietheintern the number may be slightly off but the 40% is real.
@robbietheintern PREACHHHHHHH🙌🏼

@klgroten in the way we live in it’s very rare that they face challenges that they faced back then. And Toxic Femininity is a thing. Don’t you see news stories of women killing their children, where 40% of them falsely accuse men on any crime, or the fact the 49% of abusers are women. What I’m pissed about is not that they featured some of my qualities it’s that they act women are never at fault as well. We ALL need to change not just one race or gender. There’s toxicisity all around.
@klgroten Well said! 👏🏼

@oofenshmirtz2911 im going to say this once and only once so listen up..... MASCULINITY ISN'T INHERENTLY BAD there is nothing wrong with masculinity. TOXIC masculinity is. Toxic masculinity is when you see an ad that tries to show what society doesn't find acceptable and then shows you what they want you to do instead and you throw your razor in the toilet and pout because they showcased your bad qualities. Toxic feminism isn't a thing.... The word is misogyny and that is also not acceptable but the HUGE difference is that misogyny doesn't run rampant in the streets. You feel offended by this when you should be offended that the men who behave like they just crawled out of the primordial muck are making you look bad. Take your fake outrage to them. Because they are the problem here. Have some empathy and listen when the women of the world tell you what they go through daily, and have been going through for longer than this "attack on men" you seem to think exists.

Not all men can grow facial hair and it's not their fault. It entirely depends upon the race and genetics. This is objectification / body shaming. That's why we don't want people like you to define masculinity for us.

@leaaval__ but I understand that as well but what we’re losing our shit about is that if they switched the roles everyone would be losing their shit but no one cares when it’s like this. And I saw the ending loud and clear but the ending is still drags on the same things we’re pissed about stop boys from being boys because we’re all born with the sin of masculinity. And when we try to say masculinity is not toxic we get called for mansplaining. It’s annoying.

@oofenshmirtz2911 I get the point of view that not all men are bad, and that there is a problem with toxic femininity as well. I get that point loud and clear mon frier. What I don’t get is what there is to be offended about the ad itself? Did you even watch it all? Did you see in the end where they are showing good men stepping up and working towards change? Because whether you like it or not, whether you are one of them or not, there are so. Many. Dirtbags out there contributing to this epidemic. People have to recognize that and work towards change. I don’t see what is offensive about that in any way. And with regards to the wall comment? Hey pot, meet kettle.

@leaaval__ We’re being a douchebag because you guys aren’t seeing things from our point of view and it’s frustrating. It’s like talking to a brick wall(not in the intellectual way I mean that the wall doesn’t understand because it’s a wall) and it’s annoying to us that nobody gets our point of view.

@blackwoodtyler it honest to god is the men who share the same toxic traits you see in the commercial freaking out about it. They feel personally attacked because they basically were. But it was NOT an attack on ALL men like they claim. They just refuse to see the bigger picture because it demands change and recognition of their poor behaviour

@oofenshmirtz2911 no my logic makes sense in the context I used it in, but I’m not going to waste my time arguing with another butthurt male today. I just know there’s hundreds and hundreds of thousands of men out there who actually got the message and didn’t get offended. The ones who didn’t all happen to be somewhat of a douchebag. Fancy that.
@klgroten that this was delivered like shit.
@oofenshmirtz2911 what are you even trying to say? 😂😂 Good grief.
@leaaval__ it boggle my mind the backlash it’s getting... some people really missed the whole point
@aussizzle
@leaaval__ if when you get a bad grade on a test do you go up to the teacher and say “my paper is fine. Chances are your not part of the problem if you agree with me.” Just using your logic not mine.

Like yea actually you are feeding right into it. The commercial really brought out the worst in all of the toxic males in our world
